abstract: The three automakers will share small-car technology and power trains in an attempt to compete with Toyota and Volkswagen.
snippet: The three automakers will share small-car technology and power trains in an attempt to compete with Toyota and Volkswagen.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — Renault, Nissan Motor and Daimler on Wednesday unveiled a strategic partnership to share small-car technology and power trains, in a move that comes as automakers are rapidly joining forces to cut costs.

headline.main: Daimler, Nissan and Renault Join in Small-Car Alliance
headline.print_headline: Daimler, Nissan and Renault Join in Small-Car Alliance

abstract: The number of claims involving speed control was small compared to reports that listed air bags as a problem.
snippet: The number of claims involving speed control was small compared to reports that listed air bags as a problem.
lead_paragraph: An analysis of consumer claims submitted to auto manufacturers in recent years shows that speed-control issues — like those that have led to the recall of millions of Toyota vehicles — account for a small percentage of the possible problems brought to the attention of carmakers.

headline.main: Speed Control a Small Factor in Car Claims
headline.print_headline: Speed Control a Small Factor in Car Claims

byline.original: By Jo Craven McGinty and Micheline Maynard
